meanings.definition: To give or pledge as security for the performance of an act
meanings.sent1: She will arle her favorite toy to show she will complete her chores.
meanings.sent2: He always arles his bike as a promise to return it after using it.
meanings.sent3: The cat arled her favorite ball as a guarantee she will catch the mouse.
meanings.sent4: The sun arles its light to brighten the day for all creatures.
meanings.sent5: The tree arles its roots deep into the ground for stability and growth.

meanings.definition: A pledge or token of something to come
meanings.sent1: The ring he gave her was an arle of his love and commitment.
meanings.sent2: The handshake served as an arle of their agreement to meet again.
meanings.sent3: The rainbow in the sky was an arle of good weather ahead.
meanings.sent4: The first snowflake was an arle of the winter wonderland to come.
meanings.sent5: The acorn on the ground was an arle of the mighty oak tree it would become.
